description: Essential guidelines for SMEs engaging in public sector work, including recommended software.

sections.title: What are Governance and Carbon commitments

items.question: What is SMESRI?
items.answer: The SME Sustainability Reporting Index is a microsite repository of information and resources targeted at small to medium sized businesses seeking to understand the key sustainability regulations and contractual agreements involved in UK Government contracts. Interactive tools in the form of the SMESRI Carbon Calculator and Sustainability Assessment are provided, alongside recommended third party resources for carbon reduction planning, supply chain management and end-to-end carbon accounting procedures.

items.question: Who has authored & developed SMESRI / www.smereportingportal.org?
items.answer: SMESRI is a social value project developed by Cognizant in collaboration with Birkbeck University for the benefit of SMEs based in the UK. Microsite development and content collation took place from December 2025 to January 2026, with content moderated and reviewed regularly.

items.question: Is SMESRI targeted at any specific industry (IT, Manufacturing, Procurement, etc.)?
items.answer: The content assembled as a part of the microsite is not targeted at any individual industry per say, however the government schedules and PPNs addressed across the site may be applicable to government contracts in any industry.

items.question: How does the SMESRI Carbon Calculator work & is it suitable for sustainability reporting?
items.answer: SMESRI's Carbon Calculator is based on the Department for Energy and Net Zero and Department for Business, Energy & Industrial Strategy's 'Greenhouse gas reporting: conversion factors 2025'. The calculator provides a simple user interface to compute your businesses annual carbon consumption in alignment with the government's statistical conversion factors. The tool can be used to assist with complying with Streamlined Energy and Carbon Reporting (SECR) regulations.
